title: Jon Bernthal's Unwavering Loyalty to This Underdog NFL Team May Surprise You
description: "No matter what time of day, I'm finding a way to watch those games."
content:
Jon Bernthal's Unwavering Loyalty to This Underdog NFL Team May Surprise You originally appeared on Men's Fitness.

Jon Bernthal recently made an appearance at the Washington Commanders training camp, where he expressed his love and admiration for the team.

"I've been all over this world making movies—Morocco, Ireland, Greece, you know all over Northern Africa, wherever it is—and no matter what, no matter what time of day, I'm finding a way to watch those games. And over the years, it has been hard, but right now, it's payback time," Bernthal said, as shared by ESPN.

Born in Washington D.C., the 48-year-old actor proudly calls himself a diehard Commanders fan. No matter where his acting career takes him, he stays locked in to the team’s games.

"I was on a set last year—that Hail Mary pass, I went running through the streets of Morocco, grabbing people. The truth is the truth, you can't mess with this team," he said.

Bernthal also praises the team’s character and believes in their potential.

"These guys, they're not just incredible athletes and this team isn't just so beautiful," Bernthal said. "You know for me as a father, just to see the quality of men these guys are and the role models they can be to these kids—my son's a quarterback, and for Jayden to take the time to say hello to him, Sam throw the ball with him on the field, it's just incredible."

The Commanders lost their preseason opener to the Patriots on August 8 but face the Bengals on August 18 and the Ravens on August 23.

But no matter the results, Bernthal stands by his hometown team.

"It's truly a wonderful thing to be a Commanders fan," he said. "I'm just so excited for this team. I believe in them with all my heart."
